meanings.definition: To protect or cushion with a bumper.
meanings.sent1: She was bumpering the car to prevent any damage.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was bumpering the vehicle before the race.
meanings.sent3: The children were playing a game where they pretended to be bumpering a giant toy car.
meanings.sent4: His words bumpered her from the harsh reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The soft pillows bumpered the fall, making it gentle and safe.

meanings.definition: The act of using a bumper to absorb impact.
meanings.sent1: The bumpering of the car saved it from a major collision.
meanings.sent2: The insurance company covered the cost of the bumpering after the accident.
meanings.sent3: The sound of the bumpering was like music to his ears, knowing it had protected his vehicle.
meanings.sent4: The bumpering of the ship against the dock was a loud but reassuring sound.
meanings.sent5: The bumpering of the bumper was evident from the scratches and dents on it.

meanings.definition: The material used to make a bumper.
meanings.sent1: The strong plastic was the perfect bumpering for the car.
meanings.sent2: The factory produced high-quality bumpering for various vehicle models.
meanings.sent3: She collected different types of bumpering to study their durability and effectiveness.
meanings.sent4: The shiny metal bumpering gleamed under the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The soft rubber bumpering was easy to install and provided great protection.
